head.supplied: Melbourne botanic and zoologic Garden, ¶ 14 January 1859. ¶ Sir. ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the supply of a copy of the Government Gazette for this establis...

div.p: K59/310, unit 747, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the supply of a copy of the Government Gazette for this establishment, since the knowledge of the regulations and notices contained in it, would in some instances be of advantage in my administration of this department.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary &c &c &c
On 17 January 1859 the Under Secretary, J. Moore, requested the Government Printer, J. Ferres, to furnish M with the Victoria Government gazette from the beginning of 1859.
See also J. Moore to M, 26 January 1859.
